column4: Question - if I set up a box with 1hdd to root and a pair of 500gb Software Raid 1 drives as /home, would /home be on the 500gb drives for any user I create?
yes
test access. I like to screw mine does with access allowed and access denied lists
do you by chance use gadmin for your samba needs?
no, i use smb.conf so I can configure it via ssh
I see. HAve you ever used anything else, such as a web based frontend for it? Or always ssh/smb.conf?
I suggest you add: root bin daemon nobody    to the denied list, for security
no, never had to, the file is insanely simple
I agree. I'm just trying to figure out a way to remotely handle the system. I didn't think about ssh, as I could forward that outside the router for external access.
plus its secure :)
the one thing I like about gadmin is any changes I make I can see the config file in another tab. It's not a bad way to learn the ins and outs of the real smb.conf
add   http://paste.ubuntu.com/612299/   to the file, restart smbd  and you have a share
its funny how much info is in the smb.conf. IT looks huge and confusing when nearly 90% of it is just tips and advice.
yeah a few files are like that
I can recommend deadbeef :)
deadbeef... as in, a media management application???
yeah its nice
it seems very simple. does it do playlist syncing to ipods and such?
no idea, i don't use apples garbage. my sense outstrips my wallet
you and me both. I'm just trying to get acquianted with more media players since I have a few friends who might switch to linux IF they can find something to suit their ipod needs :P
just trying to get more well educated on which apps I can recommend them.
i'd either check its feature list, or just install it and test :)

I uninstalled network manager and set it as static in the network interface file. I thought it was weird that my network connection wasnt working, then I realized it was 17.11 when the IP should be static @ 17.2
with the dhcp range being 17.10 to 17.254
I just restarted the net interfaces and now its 17.2, but it legitimently puled a DHCP address when it was set to static, which shocked me.
if you uninstall alacarte, does the package manager want to gut the OS?
was it gracefully removed last time it was removed
you may be able to resize the mac filesystem
can gparted do that or do I need a mac utility?
not sure, I don't buy mac rubbish
nor do I. It's a work laptop and I want to liberate it. :P
besides, we're moving to ubuntu, but we're not there full bore just yet. takes time!
nice but be civil pleas
use /ignore dude ;)
is there an option to not use the system tray icon..
oh wow, it doesn't even show up in alt tab....
weird??
do it in an inistalled OS and use the LiveCD to customize
not sure I understand. I installed Ubuntu on my laptop, but I'd like to snapshot it into a custom ISO and use that ISO to "reimage it" (if I dare say) when I get my SSD tomorrow.
not sure there dude, I've looked into that a few times
I'm just not sure if I can run remastersys when I'm actually booted into the install I want to back up. The guides I'm reading don't say.
killall -u $USER    works, if a bit heavy handed
is that the optimum way to quietly log out, though?
define optimum
pulling the plug on a computer is convenient to turn it off, but not optimum.
that 'ideal' not optimum
there is the gnome-session command but the command I gave will work
gnome-session-quit --no-prompt
snazzy. I'll try that out. Appreciate it.
any idea how I'd accomplish taht task (gnome-session-quit --no-prompt) but with xfce?
not sure, let me see.
looks like xfce session is xfce4-session, but not sure how to drop it. it says command not found = xfce4-session-quit --no-prompt
http://linux.die.net/man/1/xfce4-session-logout
you the man.
all I do is web search
hey, I did too.
perhaps I fail @ web search :(
sudo usermod -a -G motion jason
you are adding the user to a supplementary group, your command wil make the user in ONLY the motion group
for president.
I'm british ;)
I failed :(
you should become an expert in Motion so you can help me with understanding these ridiculous daemon issues. :D
hehe wel I'll be doing LPI101 and LP102 soon so its a step closer :)
I'm actually very fond of this software. Its proving to be quite awesome for home surveillance. I just wish I understood some of this crap more.
is usb legacy mode enabled in the BIOS?
not entirely sure. Is what I'm seeing a common symptom of that?
usb legacy is enabled in bios :(
try turning it off then, switch it to the other option
eh, it seems like it's working now.
wonder if the reboot alone helped
some_command 2>&1 | tee ~/file
thats stderr and stdout :)
cron the rsync job to run at regular  intervals

the idea is to have it active at all times, not so much scheduled. The idea here is to have two linux boxes on a LAN, no external ISP connection, and run video surveillance feeds to those two boxes. That way if mr thief jacks one box, he'll likely not realize there's a 2nd DVR on site. Problem is, cron'ing a job wouldn't fly because if it runs hourly, it'll likely miss the most important window.
you don't need a web connection for LAN sync
a cron job can run every second if you desire

I know. I meant if there was a web connection, I would just rsync the data offsite. But since we don't have a web connection, I want to LAN sync it across a 2nd box for a greater chance of retaining the footage even if a box is stolen.
how would the command ever complete itself? I would think it would cancel out the previous job, then begin the new job, therefore negating the previous point of it running.
you can use dropbox to sync over LAN
dropbox... on the LAN?
sure
why not just make a file share and have it accessible as a single point, rather than syncing it?
the idea is to have two identical boxes on the LAN, so if one gets stolen by a thief, the video feeds still exist elsewhere.
otherwise I would just share it out via samba, like I do at home with my own personal surveillance setup.
but actually, it is. Think about it. If a thief breaks in and within 3-5 minutes finds the DVR and steals it, I'm counting on those specific 3-5 minutes of his entrance to be on box B
if it's not an active sync, or an hourly sync or whatever, I could easily miss out on that time frame.
have you played with socket options?
I have not. I've never needed to. Things were always very fast.
I thought at first it was due to my encrypted home dir, but I created a samba share on my root, which isn't encrypted, and it's the same thing there.
try some different options, may help
try: socket options = TCP_NODELAY SO_KEEPALIVE SO_SNDBUF=16384 SO_RCVBUF=16384     in /etc/samba/smb.conf    there will be a line similar, just add the extra options
I didn't get a chance to try what you said for Samba, but fun thought - wireless via samba 200MB in 5 minutes. wired via samba 200MB in 2 hours. Weird.
if you copy one from ~/.config/autorun you can modify it and throw it in /usr/share/applications
cool, thanks
you may need a script to cd to the containing folder first, then execute the binary if the pwd is significant
the autorun part has me a little lost tho.
the ones in ~/.config/autorun are simple, make a copy of one and you can edit it in your favourite text editor
I don't see autorun, though
